section.title: Support for Application IO Hints
section.t: Applications can issue client I/O hints via posix_fadvise() to the NFS client. While this can help the NFS client optimize I/O and caching for a file, it does not allow the NFS server and its exported file system to do likewise. We add an IO_ADVISE procedure () to communicate the client file access patterns to the NFS server. The NFS server upon receiving a IO_ADVISE operation MAY choose to alter its I/O and caching behavior, but is under no obligation to do so.
Application specific NFS clients such as those used by hypervisors and databases can also leverage application hints to communicate their specialized requirements.
